frame.name: Mathematical_relationship
frame.definition:
<def-root>A mathematical expression <fen>Expression_1</fen> has a relationship with another mathematical expression <fen>Expression_2</fen>. This relationship may be of equality, inequality, or near-equality. The <fen>Type</fen> of the equation may be specified. Senses of LUs in this frame that are not overtly mathematical should be placed in Contigency.
<ex>The <t>FORMULA</t> of <fex name="Type">a line</fex> can be given in slope-intercept form</ex>
<ex>The equation for a line is <fex name="Expression_1">y</fex> <t>EQUALS</t> <fex name="Expression_2">mx + b</fex></ex></def-root>

FE.name: Expression_1
FE.definition:
<def-root>In an equation that has more terms on one side than the other, <fen>Expression_1</fen> is the side of the equation with fewer terms.
<ex><fex name="Expression_1">Force</fex> <t>EQUALS</t> mass * acceleration</ex></def-root>

FE.name: Expression_2
FE.definition:
<def-root>In an equation that has more terms on one side than the other, <fen>Expression_2</fen> is the side of the equation that has more terms.
<ex>Force <t>EQUALS</t> <fex name="Expression_2">mass * acceleration</fex></ex></def-root>

FE.name: Type
FE.definition: <def-root>The value or type of object that is computed by the equation.</def-root>

lexUnit.name: function.n
lexUnit.definition: COD: a relation or expression involving one or more variables.

lexUnit.name: equation.n
lexUnit.definition: COD: a statement that the values of two mathematical expressions are equal

lexUnit.name: formula.n
lexUnit.definition: COD: a mathematical relationship or rule expressed in symbols.
